message: I am thinking...: The paper describes that, instead of computing SVD exactly, they parameterize the update Δ as Δ = PΛQ to mimic SVD, where Λ is a diagonal matrix of singular values, and P, Q are left/right singular vectors. In the code, these correspond to lora_A (Q), lora_E (Λ), and lora_B (P). The forward function should thus compute the output as: x @ W^T + scaling * (x @ Q^T * Λ) @ P^T / (ranknum+1e-5), or equivalently, x @ W^T + scaling * (x @ lora_A.T * lora_E) @ lora_B.T / (ranknum+1e-5). The lora_dropout should be applied to x before the low-rank adaptation. The fan_in_fan_out flag determines whether to transpose the weight. I will now implement the forward function accordingly.

In the code, these correspond to lora_A (Q), lora_E (Λ), and lora_B (P). The forward function should thus compute the output as: x @ W^T + scaling * (x @ Q^T * Λ) @ P^T / (ranknum+1e-5), or equivalently, x @ W^T + scaling * (x @ lora_A.T * lora_E) @ lora_B.T / (ranknum+1e-5). The lora_dropout should be applied to x before the low-rank adaptation. The fan_in_fan_out flag determines whether to transpose the weight. I will now implement the forward function accordingly.
